pdftron.PDF.Annots

Class FreeText

  • java.lang.Object
    • pdftron.PDF.Annot
      • pdftron.PDF.Annots.Markup
        • pdftron.PDF.Annots.FreeText

  • public class FreeText
extends Markup
    A free text annotation (PDF 1.3) displays text directly on the page. Unlike an ordinary text annotation, a free text annotation has no open or closed state; instead of being displayed in a pop-up window, the text shall be always visible.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • e_FreeText

        public static final int e_FreeText
        This integer list spedifies the intention of the FreeText annotation e_FreeText - The annotation ntended to function as a plain free-text annotation. A plain free-text annotation is also known as a text box comment. e_FreeTextCallout - The annotation is intended to function as a callout. The callout is associated with an area on the page through the callout line specified in CL. e_FreeTextTypeWriter - The annotation is intended to function as a click-to-type or typewriter object and no callout line is drawn. e_Unknow - Undefined (Userdefined) intent type.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • e_FreeTextCallout

              Rect pos)
                       throws PDFNetException

        Parameters:
        doc - A document to which the FreeText annotation is added.
        pos - A rectangle specifying the FreeText annotation's bounds, specified in user space coordinates.
        Returns:
        A newly created blank FreeText annotation.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException

      • getDefaultAppearance

        public java.lang.String getDefaultAppearance()
                                      throws PDFNetException
        Get the default appearance of the FreeText annotation.
        Returns:
        A string representing the default appearance of the FreeText annotation.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The default appearance string shall be used in formatting the text.The annotation dictionary’s Appearance (AP) entry, if present, shall take precedence over this entry.

      • setDefaultAppearance

        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The default appearance string shall be used in formatting the text.The annotation dictionary’s Appearance (AP) entry, if present, shall take precedence over this entry.

      • getQuaddingFormat

        public int getQuaddingFormat()
                      throws PDFNetException
        Get the quading format of the FreeText annotation.
        Returns:
        A int code indicating the quading format of the FreeText annotation.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The int code specifies the form of quadding (justification) that shall be used in displaying the annotation’s text: 0Left-justified 1Centered 2Right-justified Default value: 0 (left-justified).

      • setQuaddingFormat

        public void setQuaddingFormat(int app_qform)
                       throws PDFNetException
        Set the quading format of the FreeText annotation. (Optional; PDF 1.4)
        Parameters:
        app_qform - the new quadding format
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The int code specifies the form of quadding (justification) that shall be used in displaying the annotation’s text: 0Left-justified 1Centered 2Right-justified Default value: 0 (left-justified).

      • getCalloutLinePoint1

        public Point getCalloutLinePoint1()
                           throws PDFNetException
        Get p1 of the callout line points of the FreeText annotation.
        Returns:
        Three point objects if the line is bent or two point objects if the line is straight.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The returning values are two or three Point objects specifying a callout line attached to the free text annotation. Three Point objects represent the starting, knee point, and ending coordinates of the line in default user space, two Point objects represent the starting and ending coordinates of the line., If the line is straight, i.e. only has two points, two valid points will be returned in p1 and p2, the p3 will be a point with negative x and y coordinate values.

      • getCalloutLinePoint2

        public Point getCalloutLinePoint2()
                           throws PDFNetException
        Get p2 of the callout line points of the FreeText annotation.
        Returns:
        Three point objects if the line is bent or two point objects if the line is straight.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The returning values are two or three Point objects specifying a callout line attached to the free text annotation. Three Point objects represent the starting, knee point, and ending coordinates of the line in default user space, two Point objects represent the starting and ending coordinates of the line., If the line is straight, i.e. only has two points, two valid points will be returned in p1 and p2, the p3 will be a point with negative x and y coordinate values.

      • getCalloutLinePoint3

        public Point getCalloutLinePoint3()
                           throws PDFNetException
        Get p3 of the callout line points of the FreeText annotation.
        Returns:
        Three point objects if the line is bent or two point objects if the line is straight.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The returning values are two or three Point objects specifying a callout line attached to the free text annotation. Three Point objects represent the starting, knee point, and ending coordinates of the line in default user space, two Point objects represent the starting and ending coordinates of the line., If the line is straight, i.e. only has two points, two valid points will be returned in p1 and p2, the p3 will be a point with negative x and y coordinate values.

      • setCalloutLinePoints

        public void setCalloutLinePoints(Point p1,
                        Point p2,
                        Point p3)
                          throws PDFNetException
        Set the callout line points of the FreeText annotation. (Optional; meaningful only if IT is FreeTextCallout; PDF 1.6)
        Parameters:
        p1 - The staring point.
        p2 - The ending point.
        p3 - The kee point.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The three Point objects specify a callout line attached to the free text annotation. The three Point objects represent the starting, knee point, and ending coordinates of the line in default user space.

      • getIntentName

        public int getIntentName()
                  throws PDFNetException
        Get the Intent name as an entry from the enum "IntentName" of the annnotation type.
        Returns:
        the intent name
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The intent name describes the intent of the free text annotation. The following values shall be valid: e_FreeText - The annotation is intended to function as a plain free-text annotation. A plain free-text annotation is also known as a text box comment. e_FreeTextCallout - The annotation is intended to function as a callout. The callout is associated with an area on the page through the callout line specified in CL. e_FreeTextTypeWriter - The annotation is intended to function as a click-to-type or typewriter object and no callout line is drawn. Default value: e_FreeText

      • setIntentName

        public void setIntentName(int mode)
                   throws PDFNetException
        Set the Intent name as an entry from the enum "IntentName" of the annnotation type. (Optional; PDF 1.4)
        Parameters:
        mode - The intent name of the annotation as an entry from the enum "IntentJName".
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The intent name describes the intent of the free text annotation. The following values shall be valid: e_FreeText - The annotation is intended to function as a plain free-text annotation. A plain free - text annotation is also known as a text box comment. e_FreeTextCallout - The annotation is intended to function as a callout. The callout is associated with an area on the page through the callout line specified in CL. e_FreeTextTypeWriter - The annotation is intended to function as a click-to-type or typewriter object and no callout line is drawn. Default value: e_FreeText

      • getEndingStyle

        public int getEndingStyle()
                   throws PDFNetException
        Get the ending style of the callout line of the FreeText Annotation.
        Returns:
        The ending style represented as one of the entries of the enum "EndingStyle"
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        The ending style specifies the line ending style that shall be used in drawing the callout line specified in CallOut Line Points (CL). The enum entry shall specify the line ending style for the endpoint defined by the starting point(p1) of the CallOut Line Points. Default value: e_None.

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(ColorPt color,
                int col_comp)
                  throws PDFNetException
        Set the text color of the FreeText Annotation.
        Parameters:
        color - ColorPt object representing the color.
        col_comp - number of colorant components in ColorPt object.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        Current implementation of this method creates a non-standard entry in the annotation dictionary and uses it to generate the appearance stream. Make sure you call RefreshAppearance() after changing text or line color, and remember that editing the annotation in other PDF application will produce different appearance.

      • getTextColor

        public ColorPt getTextColor()
                     throws PDFNetException
        Returns the text color of the FreeText Annotation.
        Returns:
        the text color
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
        Note:
        Current implementation of this method uses a non-standard entry in the annotation dictionary and will not return meaningful results when called on annotations not created with PDFTron software.
